Package soot.jimple.infoflow.solver.cfg

Interface IInfoflowCFG

  • All Superinterfaces:
    soot.jimple.toolkits.ide.icfg.BiDiInterproceduralCFG<soot.Unit,​soot.SootMethod>, heros.InterproceduralCFG<soot.Unit,​soot.SootMethod>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BackwardsInfoflowCFG, InfoflowCFG
    public interface IInfoflowCFG
extends soot.jimple.toolkits.ide.icfg.BiDiInterproceduralCFG<soot.Unit,​soot.SootMethod>

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  IInfoflowCFG.UnitContainer
      Abstraction of a postdominator.

      Checks whether the given method or any of its transitive callees has side effects

      Gets whether the two given units are connected by an exceptional control flow edge

    • Method Detail

      • getPostdominatorOf

        IInfoflowCFG.UnitContainer getPostdominatorOf​(soot.Unit u)
        Gets the postdominator of the given unit. If this unit is a conditional, the postdominator is the join point behind both branches of the conditional.
        Parameters:
        u - The unit for which to get the postdominator.
        Returns:
        The postdominator of the given unit

      • getDominatorOf

        IInfoflowCFG.UnitContainer getDominatorOf​(soot.Unit u)
        Gets the dominator of the given unit. If this unit is a conditional, the dominator is the join point above both branches of the conditional.
        Parameters:
        u - The unit for which to get the postdominator.
        Returns:
        The postdominator of the given unit

      • getConditionalBranchIntraprocedural

        List<soot.Unit> getConditionalBranchIntraprocedural​(soot.Unit callSite)
        Reconstructs if the unit is inside a conditional. Needed for implicit backwards on an unbalanced return into a method.
        Parameters:
        callSite - The unit to start the search at
        Returns:
        The same-level conditional

      • getConditionalBranchesInterprocedural

        List<soot.Unit> getConditionalBranchesInterprocedural​(soot.Unit unit)
        Reconstructs the conditionals a taint could possibly reach. Needed for implicit backward flows to model sink calls inside a callee
        Parameters:
        unit - start unit, possibly a sink
        Returns:
        List of units with the context appended

      • isStaticFieldRead

        boolean isStaticFieldRead​(soot.SootMethod method,
                          soot.SootField variable)
        Checks whether the given static field is read inside the given method or one of its transitive callees.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to check
        variable - The static field to check
        Returns:
        True if the given static field is read inside the given method, otherwise false

      • isStaticFieldUsed

        boolean isStaticFieldUsed​(soot.SootMethod method,
                          soot.SootField variable)
        Checks whether the given static field is used (read or written) inside the given method or one of its transitive callees.
        Parameters:
        method - The method to check
        variable - The static field to check
        Returns:
        True if the given static field is used inside the given method, otherwise false

      • hasSideEffects

        boolean hasSideEffects​(soot.SootMethod method)
        Checks whether the given method or any of its transitive callees has side effects
        Parameters:
        method - The method to check
        Returns:
        True if the given method or one of its transitive callees has side effects, otherwise false

      • notifyMethodChanged

        void notifyMethodChanged​(soot.SootMethod m)
        Re-initializes the mapping betwween statements and owning methods after a method has changed.
        Parameters:
        m - The method for which to re-initialize the mapping

        Parameters:

        v - The value to check

        Parameters:

        v - The value to check
        Returns:

      • isExceptionalEdgeBetween

        boolean isExceptionalEdgeBetween​(soot.Unit u1,
                                 soot.Unit u2)
        Gets whether the two given units are connected by an exceptional control flow edge
        Parameters:
        u1 - The first unit
        u2 - The second unit
        Returns:
        True if the two given units are directly connected by an exceptional control flow edge, otherwise false

      • getOrdinaryCalleesOfCallAt

        Collection<soot.SootMethod> getOrdinaryCalleesOfCallAt​(soot.Unit u)
        Gets all ordinary callees of the call at call site u, i.e., those that are not \ or a fake edge.
        Parameters:
        u - The call site
        Returns:
        The set of ordinary callees of the given call site

      • isExecutorExecute

        boolean isExecutorExecute​(soot.jimple.InvokeExpr ie,
                          soot.SootMethod dest)
        Checks whether the given call is a call to Executor.execute() or AccessController.doPrivileged() and whether the callee matches the expected method signature
        Parameters:
        ie - The invocation expression to check
        dest - The callee of the given invocation expression
        Returns:
        True if the given invocation expression and callee are a valid call to Executor.execute() or AccessController.doPrivileged()

      • isReflectiveCallSite

        boolean isReflectiveCallSite​(soot.Unit u)
        Checks whether the given call site is a reflective method call
        Parameters:
        u - The call site to check
        Returns:
        True if the given call site contains a reflective method call, otherwise false

      • isReflectiveCallSite

        boolean isReflectiveCallSite​(soot.jimple.InvokeExpr iexpr)
        Checks whether the given call site is a reflective method call
        Parameters:
        iexpr - The call site to check
        Returns:
        True if the given call site contains a reflective method call, otherwise false

      • purge

        void purge()
        Clears all caches and temporary data from memory. This method has no effect on the functional behavior of the class.
